title: Carrie Lam â€˜s response towards Hong Konger is unacceptable

replies.msg:
Dear foreigners,

As there was a public announcement from Carrie Lam this evening (4 Sep) which agree to withdraw the extradition bill. As a Hong Konger, I would like to clarify a few things.
For the situation right now in Hong Kong. It is not just a matter of the extradition bill anymore.
During these few months, the protest revealed the deep corruption of Hong Kong government which we could never imagine of.
The reason why this unprecedented movement became unprecedented is the anger and disappointment from people and the will to fight for what we should deserve, the basic human rights, the freedom, the democracy.

Without fulfilling the five demands
Hong Konger will never step back

Please stand with us.
Thank you.

Regards,
A Hong Konger who love his/her home

Please dont take this as a victory, we hk people will keep fighting for freedom and keep protesting . Please stay with hong kong.

replies.msg:
Carrie Lam must know that by simply announcing the withdrawal of the bill without meeting the other 4 demands can in no way bring any hope of peace back to society; or I must have overestimated her intelligence.
I can't help but wonder why the obstinate refusals to setting up an independent inquiry commission? Not that it will definitely be accepted by the protesters because all depends on the specifics, but the unreasonable and repeated refusals do suggest something seriously insidious. And let's bear in mind that of all parties involved, it's ONLY the police who, according to Lam, resolutely oppose to the inquiry!!
Think about it and one may confidently draw some foregone conclusions.

To all foreign friends: a few minutes ago, Carrie Lam completely withdrew the extradition bill. This may seems to be a win for us, but she only managed to met ONE of our five demands. Our five demands are:
1. Withdrawal of the extradition bill from the legislative process
2. Retraction of the characterisation of the protests as "riots"
3. Release and exoneration of arrested protesters
4. Establishment of an independent commission of inquiry into police behaviour
5. Universal suffrage for Legislative Council and Chief Executive election
With reference with one of our slogan: five demands, no one less, we shall fight on until all our demands had been met. The withdrawal of the bill would not stop us from fighting for freedom.

#standwithHK

We have five demands. Withdrawal of the amendment bill is only one of them. The five demands are:
1. Full withdrawal of the extradition bill
2. A commission of inquiry into alleged police brutality
3. Retracting the classification of protesters as “rioters”
4. Amnesty for arrested protesters
5. Dual universal suffrage for both the Legislative Council and
the Chief Executive
The 2nd, 3rd, and the 4th demands arise because the government refused to withdraw the bill amendment after a marching of 1 million Hong Kong people. The 5th demand is the ultimate solution of the turmoil in Hong Kong.
Now the government withdraws the bill, and it is not a concession at all. It’s only a tactic of the government trying to kill the movement by the people.

FIVE DEMANDS NOT ONE LESS

What she said is not withdrawing the bill, but put up a "withdrawal motion".
This is different from withdrawing the bill. Legislative members will debate the motion, and the conclusion can be a Nay, which means that the bill is not withdrawn! (The reason why we think the conclusion is Nay is another long story about the undemocratic election process in HK, which I omit now.)
In fact, according to the Rules of Procedure of the Legislative Council (screenshot below, also found in https://www.legco.gov.hk/general/english/procedur/content/partk.htm):

She can directly "announce" the withdrawal. Why put up a motion?

You may think we are being paranoid, but this is a result of being deceived too many times. The government has been faking literally for a long time. We have to be very meticulous about the wordings they use.
(Let me give you an example. The Secretary of Finance was once accused of holding some land to be developed and had conflict of interest. Then he said that not him but "a relative of his wife" owned the land. Guess who this "relative" is? It was his son!)

we did not win, and we are still miles away from winning.  The damage done by China gov and hongkong gov cannot be simply undone by withdrawing the bill.  People died to pursue freedom, a girl got blinded, thousands got arrested, and countless numbers of Hongkonger got beaten up, got fired because they stood up to protect their home.  And even at this moment, there are still people who under arrest, and face up to 10 years of jail.  Freedom has a price, we are willing to pay; some matters cannot be undone, we all understand.  But we will not give in, not until our people are free those charges, not until all the unlawful actions by police force are investigated, not until justice be done.  We stand our ground, all 5 demands from people must be met.

The problem is the Public Order Ordinance, which has been used to charge the protesters, is unreasonable. A person who has been charged as rioters can be locked in the prison for 10 years. If the police assured that today protest is a riot, everyone who has ever showed up in the event can be charged even you just stood there and did nothing.

It is totally different from the western countries since the Hong Kong people need to apply for the Letter of No Objection to protest or assembly. Even if some protesters have not been charged as riot, they may obtain criminal records for a lifetime because they have showed up in an illegal activity.

AND THE MOST IMPORTANT THING IS THIS LAW WAS SET UP 60 YEARS AGO, WHICH HAS NEVER BEEN UPDATED.

And the funniest thing is, the Letter of No Objection has been declined by the police since August with various reasons.

We have never won anything under this political system, not even talking about the free election we wanted since the Umbrella Revolution or what the police has done to our female protesters.

Dear foreigners,

As there was a public announcement from Carrie Lam this evening (4 Sep) which agree to withdraw the extradition bill. As a Hong Konger, I would like to clarify a few things.
For the situation right now in Hong Kong. It is not just a matter of the extradition bill anymore.
During these few months, the protest revealed the deep corruption of Hong Kong government which we could never imagine of.
The reason why this unprecedented movement became unprecedented is the anger and disappointment from people and the will to fight for what we should deserve, the basic human rights, the freedom, the democracy.

Without fulfilling the five demands
Hong Konger will never step back

Please stand with us.
Thank you.

Regards,
A Hong Konger who love his/her home

Dear foreigners,

As a Hong Konger, I would like to clarify a few things in relation to Carrie Lam's announcement this evening (4 September).

Firstly, the extradition bill is not withdrawn yet. The motion of withdrawing the bill will be proposed to the LegCo. However, as the majority of LegCo member is pro-government, there’s no guarantee that the bill will be withdrawn. In fact, there is a chance that the bill will still pass.

Secondly, Hong Kongers will not stop until the five demands were met.
1. Withdraw extradition bill (æ’¤æƒ¡æ³•)
2. Independent investigation into police brutality (æŸ¥è­¦æš´)
3. Drop charges against protesters (éŠ·æ§ç½ª)
4. Retract the labeling of the protest as a riot (éæš´å‹•)
5. Universal suffrage

Please support our fight for democracy, human rights, and freedom.

Thank you.

Regards,

Hong Konger
